metadata.title: CASE 262/04: Report on Allegations of Evasion of Pristina Airport Charges
metadata.primary_source: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK)

overview: The document investigates allegations of revenue evasion by an airline at Pristina Airport, focusing on check-in procedures, passenger tax collection, and financial recording issues.

methodology.description: Collection and review of financial records from Pristina Airport and interviews to gather relevant information.
interviews: Official of the Passenger Handling Services, Pristina Airport
documents_reviewed: Records of funds received from the Airline for 2004-01-01;2004-06-30
Receipt book of cash payments for landing and handling
Price List for Basic Airport Services issued on 2002-01-01
Management Letter dated 2004-05-01 on the 2003 Financial Audit

background.context: An airline flying from a European Airport to Pristina is suspected of not paying appropriate airport charges.
timeline: 2004-07-22: Monitoring of Airline’s inward and outward flights occurred.

allegations.description: Failure to collect all revenues for landing, handling and passenger tax by Pristina Airport from the Airline.
allegations.findings: No record of passenger tax payments for passengers departing with the Airline. Security and immigration staff are not liable as they didn't use check-in facilities.

allegations.description: Non-integration of the automatic checking system with financial reporting.
allegations.findings: Potential loss of revenue from passenger taxes due to non-integrated systems at Pristina Airport.

findings: The airline paid all charges levied by Pristina Airport.
Check-in procedures at Pristina Airport comply with the described process, reducing revenue risk.
Flight designated as humanitarian subject to review for charge compliance.

actions: Implement stricter oversight on airport fee collection.
Ensure integration of the automatic checking system with financial reporting.
Regular review of flight designation compliance.
Address the request of the Airline to be granted conventional credit facilities.
Review and seek to cease the occurrence of cash transactions for standard services.
Provide a written response to the issues described in the report.
